content.description: Climb up to the knifeblade/pin and clip it before pulling over the bulge.  Follow a small crack that disappears as you get higher.  Hop over the chockstones and continue towards the anchors.  Rope drag can be a problem, so bring long runners.
content.protection: Small pro and a QD for the knifeblade/pin.  Two chains for anchors.
content.location: Look for the knifeblade/pin in a small crack.  Follow this small crack up to the chockstone.  Near Traverse Start (aka "Knifeblade")

content.description: Climb up the vegetated crack just East of the chimney/corner.  Follow the flake up to a bulge.  Avoid the vegetation under the large roof to the right.  Climb up the arete that terminates in the roof for an easier 5.7 variation.  For the 5.10d move, climb up the West side of the bulge.  Once over the bulge, climb an easy slab to the anchors.  Bring slings to reduce rope drag for TR.
content.protection: Protection available up to the bulge, but really runout before the crux, and no protection until well after the crux.  Better left as a TR.  2 chains well spaced up top for a rappel.
content.location: Shares the start with the only sport route on the wall, but follows the flake to the right before heading upwards.  East of Unknown.

content.description: This is the only "sport" route at Pete's Rock.  Climb up an easy vegetated crack to a flake.  Reach up for the right-diagonalling crack and continue up to a rest ledge at the first bolt.  Pull the small roof to a hidden second bolt.  Clip the third bolt under the big roof up top, reach for the jugs and pull up to the anchors.
content.protection: 3 bolts lead to 2 bolts with rings for anchors.  Bring some medium to small gear for the flake and diagonalling crack.
content.location: Sport Route right of Corner/Chimney. Start in the corner/chimney system at the bottom of the traverse.  Rappel off.

content.description: A traverse that skirts the base of Pete's Rock.  This traverse is along the right half of the SW face.  Look for the overly chalked line.  It never gets very high off the ground, maybe 10 feet at most.  Doing laps on this will generate a nice pump.
The left arete on the boulder that contains The Scoop.  The best line up this short boulder.
The small boulder just off the road, 20 feet west of Pete's Rock has a smooth west face.  This climbs that in the scooped out area.  Short.
Walking over from the parking area, this well-chalked face is on the furthest left side of Pete's Rock. Lots of possibilities, which makes for good games of eliminate or creative solo sessions.
The right arete of the boulder that contains The Scoop.  A bit shorter than The Scoop.
